definition: twice the effort for half the result
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
(two, three etc) -fold/times (multiplier)/double/to increase or multiply
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: This method of duplication of efforts, and now no longer practical.
sentences.chinese: 這種事倍功半的方法，現在已經不實用了。

sentences.english: If you insist on the old rules, it would accomplish with double effort.
sentences.chinese: 如果你堅持老辦法，必然會事倍功半。

sentences.english: Has missed preschool education this critical period often the wasted effort.
sentences.chinese: 錯過了學前教導這一要害期則往往事倍功半。

sentences.english: Although well begun is half done, we still try our best.
sentences.chinese: 雖然能事倍功半，但我們仍要盡全力做到最好。

sentences.english: We are always no time to see them.
It achieves half the result with twice the effort unless professional planner guidance.
sentences.chinese: 如沒有專業策劃的人員指點，結果往往是事倍功半。

sentences.english: Otherwise, is very likely to will be a matter doubly work quasi, even bad body's appetite.
sentences.chinese: 不然，就很有可能會是事倍功半，甚至壞人食慾。

sentences.english: Missed this critical period of pre-school education are often less effective.
sentences.chinese: 錯過了學前教育這一關鍵期則往往事倍功半。

sentences.english: So it would make things worse if they miss such education.
sentences.chinese: 錯過了學前教育這一關鍵期則往往事倍功半。

definition: half the work, twice the effect (idiom); the right approach saves effort and leads to better results/a stitch in time saves nine
to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/also written 欲速則不達|欲速则不达
to produce the opposite of the desired result
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
futile endeavor (idiom)
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
lit. to fish for three days and sun-dry the nets for two days (proverb)/fig. not to persevere in doing sth/to do sth by fits and starts
pinyin: san1 tian1 da3 yu2 , liang3 tian1 shai4 wang3

definition: arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
careless/any-old-how, regardless of the specific task
pinyin: mei2 mao5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

definition: to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: to yield results
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
